Liverpool transfer news: Honduras defender Wesly Decas offered week-long trial at Anfield 
Left-back Decas has earned his reward for outstanding performances at the Concacaf Under 20's Championship By Geoff Sweet 15th March 2017, 4:12 pm Updated: 15th March 2017, 6:22 pm HONDURAN teenager Wesly Decas has been offered a week-long trial with Liverpool. 
The 17-year-old left back impressed Anfield scouts at a recent Under 20’s tournament. Getty Images 3 Wesly Ducas looks on as Honduran team-mate Denil Maldonado tests Costa Rica’s Andy Reyes 
Decas was said to be one of the standout performers at the Concafac Championship and was on the losing side in the final as Honduras lost out to the USA on penalties.

So Decas could find his game-time limited and he must decide if he wants to compete with the former Barcelona youth product for a place in the U23’s starting line-up.
